html:
The following factors could affect Italian markets on Friday.

Reuters has not verified the newspaper reports, and cannot vouch for their accuracy. New items are marked with (*).


For a complete list of diary events in Italy please click on IT/DIA.


GENERAL

Italy reported 69 coronavirus-related deaths on Thursday against 72 the day before, the health ministry said, while the daily tally of new infections rose to 10,638 from 10,172. (Full Story)

Italy's COVID-19 Special Commissioner was given a mandate by the health ministry to acquire 50,000 courses of each of Merck's MRK.N and Pfizer's PFE.N COVID-19 antiviral drugs, his office said in a statement. (Full Story)


ECONOMY

ISTAT releases September industry sales data (0900 GMT).


COMPANIES


MEDIASET MS.MI

French media group Vivendi VIV.PA will vote in favour of plans to introduce a dual class share structure at Italian broadcaster Mediaset MS.MI, the companies said on Thursday. (Full Story)

CNH CNHI.MI

Iveco will focus on zero-emission trucks and buses and aim to act like a nimble startup as its owner CNH Industrial prepares to spin off the unit to concentrate on farm machinery and construction equipment. (Full Story)

GENERALI GASI.MI

Construction magnate Francesco Gaetano Caltagirone has further increased his stake in Italy's biggest insurer to 7.2%, taking the overall holding of a shareholder pact with Italian businessman Leonardo del Vecchio and banking foundation Fondazione CRT to 14%.

(*) Caltagirone is considering proposing a woman as chairperson of the insurer, Mf said.


(*) PRYSMIAN PRY.MI

The European Union said on Thursday it will impose tariffs on optical fibre cables from China after an investigation found they were being sold at artificially low prices. (Full Story)


OVS OVS.MI

OVS said its sales in the third quarter were about 378 million euros, up 11%. (Full Story)


BF BFG.MI, ENI ENI.MI, INTESA SANPAOLO ISP.MI

The holding company that controls agricultural firm Bonifiche Ferraresi has signed agreements for Eni and Intesa Sanpaolo to enter its capital.


(*) M&A, ITA

Delta Air Lines DAL.N is considering buying a stake in state-owned Italian carrier Italia Trasporto Aereo (ITA) to boost its presence in the European market, daily La Repubblica reported on Friday, citing government sources. (Full Story)

DIARY

Antitrust authority ends the investigation on Amazon AMZN.O.

Rome, President Sergio Mattarella attends 'National Cancer Research Day' celebration (1000 GMT).

Rome, farmers' body Coldiretti and The European House Ambrosetti end annual "Agricolture and Food forum".

Milan, Justice Minister Marta Cartabia attends panel "From Kabul to Rome, defending rights" at conference on Afghanistan (1700 GMT).

Milan, Bank of Italy Milan's headquarters presents "The Lombardy economy, economic update" (1100 GMT).

Milan, "Financecommunity Week 2021" ends.

Naples, Chamber of Deputies Speaker Roberto Fico visits the confiscated mafia property 'La Gloriette' Casa G.L.O. (Youth, Legality, Employment) (1030 GMT).


((Milan newsroom, +39 02 6612 9507, fax +39 02 801149,
milan.newsroom@news.reuters.com))
